column1: --encode          Generate Base64-encoded services configuration extractor script instead of raw PowerShell.
--help            show this help message and exit
--interesting-only but with stricter criteria. A service is labeled as a great candidate for privilege escalation if the service's START_TYPE == DEMAND_START AND TYPE ==
--list-generic   List all predefined generic access rights.
--quiet           Do not print the banner on startup.
--verbose         Print the user's SID and group membership info as well (not applicable in Audit mode).

--audit           Audit mode. Analyzes all service ACEs without searching for user-specific abusable services (Long output). This option also downgrades the extractor script, omitting the retrieval of
--get-service    This option modifies the extractor script to use Get-Service for listing available services. While cleaner, it may not work with a low-privileged account. The default Get-ChildItem

--interesting-only but with stricter criteria. A service is labeled as a great candidate for privilege escalation if the service's START_TYPE == DEMAND_START AND TYPE == WIN32_OWN_PROCESS AND your user has (WRITE_PROPERTY AND CONTROL_ACCESS) OR GENERIC_ALL privileges.")
